variant.name: GraphValidation
variant.summary: graph-based validation

variant.name: OrderValidation
variant.summary: order-based validation

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.AttemptSucceeded
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an external display. Every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is changed by the user, Chrome attempts to modeset the display. This metric tracks the result of those attempts. Resolution and RefreshRate metrics will be recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an external display. This is recorded after Chrome attempted all the available modes and finally modeset the display. All the previously attempted modes and refreshes, including the successful one will be recorded.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.AttemptSucceeded
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. Chrome might try additional modes after a failed attempt. Every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is changed by the user, Chrome attempts to modeset the display. This metric tracks the result of those attempts. Resolution and RefreshRate metrics will be recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. This is recorded after Chrome attempted all the available modes and finally modeset the display. All the previously attempted modes and refreshes, including the successful one will be recorded.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.FinalTaskStatus
histogram.summary:
The final result of a configuration attempt across all displays. This is recorded every time Chrome configures all connected displays, or fails to do so after exhausting all available modes in one (or more) of the displays.
Partial success occurs when a configuration is successful, but not with the requested resolution/refresh rate for one (or more) of the connected displays (e.g. a display fails to modeset at 4k@60Hz, but succeeds at 1440p@60Hz).

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.MstExternalDisplaysCount
histogram.summary: Total number of external displays connected via MST and being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.MstExternalDisplaysPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of external displays connected via MST and being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.Test.DynamicCRTCs.{NumDisplays}.PermutationsAttempted
histogram.summary: Number of fallback CRTC-Connector permutations attempted after initial test modeset failure with {NumDisplays} connected. All permutations after success are not counted.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.Test.{NumDisplays}.Outcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of test-only modeset configuration request. If a test modeset initially fails, but succeeds on fallback, then it will be counted as FallbackSuccess.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.TotalExternalDisplaysCount
histogram.summary: Total number of external displays being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.{Connection}.Modeset.Success.RefreshRate
histogram.summary: Tracks an {Connection} display's resulting refresh rate after a successful display configuration.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.{Connection}.Modeset.{Report}.Resolution
histogram.summary: {Connection} {Report}

variant.name: External
variant.summary: Tracks an external display's

variant.name: Internal
variant.summary: Tracks an internal display's

variant.name: OriginalRequest
variant.summary: original resolution request during display configuration.

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: resulting resolution after a successful display configuration.

histogram.name: Display.External.BlockZeroSerialNumberType
histogram.summary: The type of serial number retrieved from block zero of a display's EDID during EDID parsing.

histogram.name: Display.External.NumOfSerialNumbersProvided
histogram.summary: The number of serial numbers provided in an EDID (i.e. via block zero and/or the serial number descriptor block). Values should be in the range of 0-2.

histogram.name: Display.External.ParseEdidOptionals
histogram.summary: The availability (or lack thereof) of tracked optional fields during EDID parsing of external.

histogram.name: Display.MultipleDisplays.GenerateId.CollisionDetection
histogram.summary: Whether or not multiple connected displays produced identical display IDs due to incomplete EDIDs. This may occur when identical displays (same make and model) lack serial numbers in both the EDID's block zero or S/N descriptor block. Recorded every time Chrome OS detects a change in display configuration and attempts to get an updated list of available displays.

histogram.name: Display.ParseEdidFailure
histogram.summary: Type of failure that occurs during EDID parsing. Typically the failure is caused by a mismatch between the EDID size and the expected offset of the data component.

histogram.name: GPU.Android.HasEGLDupNativeFenceFunction
histogram.summary: Recordes whether the eglDupNativeFenceFDANDROIDFn function is exported. Recorded once on eglDisplay init, which is basically once on GPU process start.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Buffer11CPUMemoryMB
histogram.summary: The sum of the size of the CPU-side memory allocations of Buffer11's copies (vs. GPU memory allocations). These allocations are used when modifying the buffer data on the CPU or when transfering to GPU memory via DMA.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11CreateDeviceError
histogram.summary: An extended Windows error code returned from D3D11CreateDevice on error when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use. Can be almost any valid HRESULT or DXGI error code, which are listed at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb509553.aspx.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: The maxmium supported (or currently requested) Direct3D feature level in D3D11 ANGLE. We support as low as 9.3, and as high as 11.1, though Chrome should only use 10.0+ for D3D11. Gives an indication of how new a user's video card is, what features it supports, and it's general speed tier. Recorded on D3D device initialization, loss, or reset when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11InitializeResult
histogram.summary: The result from initializing a D3D11 device in ANGLE. Can be success, or one of several error codes which indicate different reasons for failing. Recorded on D3D11 device initialization when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D9InitializeResult
histogram.summary: The result from initializing a D3D9 device in ANGLE. Can be success, or one of several error codes which indicate different reasons for failing. Recorded on D3D9 device initialization when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3DDeviceRemovedReason
histogram.summary: Error codes received when checking for D3D device removal reason. HRESULT is DXGI error code that listed at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11/nf-d3d11-id3d11device-getdeviceremovedreason

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3DShaderBlobSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size of compiled D3D shader bytecode.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3DShaderCompilationTimeUs
histogram.summary: The time it takes for fxc to compile HLSL to D3D bytecode. Recorded for all clients regardless of support for high resolution timers. NOTE: metric expired from 2025-01-05 to 2025-10-09.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.MetalShaderCompilationTimeUs
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the Metal driver to compile a shader with the newLibraryFromSource function. Recorded for all clients regardless of support for high resolution timers.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.SyncFromNativeContextMicroseconds
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time that it took for WebView to save HWUI's GL state when using ANGLE. Recorded once per saving of HWUI state when drawing with GL. Recorded for all clients as ANGLE does not support checking for high-resolution clocks (in practice, all Android devices have high-resolution clocks). Note: Expired on June 1 2024 and revived on June 10 2024.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLECanEmulateGLES3
histogram.summary: Records whether ANGLE is able to emulate GLES3 on desktop platforms. Recorded once per GPU process launch.

histogram.name: GPU.BlocklistEntriesApplied
histogram.summary: One or more entries are recorded to this histogram after each succesful GPU process launch. Each GPU blocklist entry, contained in software_rendering_list.json, that applies has the entry id recorded. Additionally the value 0, which doesn't correspond to a blocklist entry, is always recorded once to provide a denominator to calculate percentages.

histogram.name: GPU.BlocklistFeatureTestResults.{GPUBlocklistPerFeature}
histogram.summary: Counts number of browser invocations for which a GPU feature is allowed/blocklisted/disabled.

histogram.name: GPU.CanvasOopRaster.OopRasterAndGpuAcceleration
histogram.summary: Records, during GPU process initialization, the combination of the following two features being enabled/disabled: 1) Accelerated 2D Canvas 2) OOP Rasterization of Canvas.

histogram.name: GPU.CompositingMode
histogram.summary: Records what compositing mode (software, GL, etc.) Chrome is using every five minutes. This is the default compositing mode that most windows will use. There are some window types (eg. menus on some platforms) that always use software compositing and ignore the default.

histogram.name: GPU.ContextLost.{ContextType}
histogram.summary: The reason a GPU command buffer context of a given type was lost.

variant.name: BrowserCompositor
variant.summary: A browser process UI + display compositor command buffer context

variant.name: BrowserMainThread
variant.summary: A browser process shared main thread command buffer context

variant.name: BrowserRasterWorker
variant.summary: A browser process raster worker command buffer context

variant.name: DisplayCompositor
variant.summary: A display compositor command buffer context

variant.name: Media
variant.summary: A media worker command buffer context

variant.name: RendererBlinkWorker
variant.summary: A renderer blink worker GPU command buffer context

variant.name: RendererCompositor
variant.summary: A renderer compositor GPU command buffer context

variant.name: RendererMainThread
variant.summary: A renderer shared main thread GPU command buffer context

variant.name: RendererRasterWorker
variant.summary: A renderer raster worker GPU command buffer context

variant.name: Unknown
variant.summary: A GPU command buffer context of unknown type

variant.name: VideoAccelerator
variant.summary: A VideoAccelerator GPU command buffer context

variant.name: VideoCapture
variant.summary: A VideoCapture GPU command buffer context

variant.name: VideoTrackRecorder
variant.summary: A VideoTrackRecorder GPU command buffer context

variant.name: WebCodecsReadback
variant.summary: A WebCodecs background readback GPU command buffer context

variant.name: WebGL
variant.summary: A WebGL GPU command buffer context

variant.name: WebGPU
variant.summary: A WebGPU control command buffer context

variant.name: XRCompositing
variant.summary: A command buffer context used for XR compositing

histogram.name: GPU.D3D11FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: Records the highest D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL available, collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping. This is Windows platform only.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D12FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: The maximum D3D12 feature level supported in the gpu drivers. It is recorded in the browser process 120 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D12HighestShaderModel2
histogram.summary: The maximum supported D3D shader model version on a D3D12 device. It is recorded in the browser process 120 seconds after the browser launch. Note that the "2" suffix was added when a fix was made in how this stat is collected: the previous unsuffixed version would store "unknown/unsupported" on systems that supported shader model 5.1 to 6.5, but were unaware of 6.6. The suffixed version correctly stores the highest supported shader model.

histogram.name: GPU.D3DShaderModel
histogram.summary: ANGLE's currently active D3D shader model version. Logged once every startup of the GPU process, on Windows only. Note that Shader Models 2 and 3 map to D3D9 with ANGLE, and 4+ map to D3D11 ANGLE.

histogram.name: GPU.Dawn.AdapterFeatureLevel
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the Dawn device used by Graphite supports Core or Compatibility level.

histogram.name: GPU.Dawn.InfoCollectionTimeMS
histogram.summary: Measures the time to collect Dawn information during GPU info collection. NOTE: metric expired from 2024-06-25 to 2025-05-01.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.CommitAndClearPendingOverlaysDuration
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of CommitAndClearPendingOverlays, which contains the work to update the DCLayerTree's visual contents, visual tree, and commit. This estimates the amount of work DCLayerTree needs to do per frame and can be used to compare incremental tree updating algorithms.
Only reported on systems which have high resolution timers.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.CompositionMode2.VideoOrCanvas
histogram.summary: How the Desktop Window Manager presented Chrome's DirectComposition layers of video or canvas elements to the screen. Only recorded on Windows. NOTE: This metric was expired and not collecting data between 2021-12-31 and crrev.com/c/4041850 (M110).

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayer.YUVOverlayCount
histogram.summary: The number of YUV overlays we are going to present in each frame if the number is not 0. Recorded when the overlay processor is called for drawing a frame.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult.Texture
histogram.summary: Recorded for each quad (on overlay processing) the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay. Reported for Texture quad type. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-05-01 to 2022-06-24 and again from 2023-08-20 and 2023-12-21; data may be missing.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult.Video.{GPUProtectedVideoType}
histogram.summary: Recorded for each quad (on overlay processing) with protected video type the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.HardwareOverlaysSupported
histogram.summary: True if the GPU driver supports hardware overlays. Recorded during Chrome GPU initialization and each time the overlay caps change.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.IsUnderlay
histogram.summary: Recorded for each video quad during the video playback whether it is an underlay or an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlayFormatUsed3
histogram.summary: Which overlay format was chosen for YUV overlays. Recorded once per GPU process launch only if hardware overlays are supported. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2022-05-01 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaysSupported
histogram.summary: True if Chrome will try to use DirectComposition overlays. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2021-10-04 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainCreationResult3.SoftwareProtected.{SoftwareProtectedType}
histogram.summary: Whether creating swap chain for protected video succeeded. Recorded once per swap chain creation.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainCreationResult3.{GPUProtectedVideoType}
histogram.summary: Whether creating swap chain for protected video succeeded. Recorded once per swap chain creation.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainFormat3
histogram.summary: What format was used for each overlay swap chain on each swap buffers. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2020-12-31 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.VideoPresentationMode
histogram.summary: What code path was used to present a video frame. Recorded on each present. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2022-03-06 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DrDcEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether DrDC (Direct Rendering Display Compositor) is enabled or not. Recorded when CompositorGpuThread is created in GpuServiceImpl.

histogram.name: GPU.DriverBugTestResultsPerEntry
histogram.summary: For every entry in the gpu driver bug list that is hit on a machine, this records the id. Entry 0 is the total number of times that data is recorded. It should be recorded whenever new GPU information is received: on startup, whenever a GPU process launches, and whenever the active GPU changes.

histogram.name: GPU.EGLDisplayType
histogram.summary: The display type used to ask for an EGLDisplay.

histogram.name: GPU.EnsureWorkVisibleDuration
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of EnsureWorkVisible GPU call. Since it's blocking UI thread we want to measure it, and this histogram must be active as long as this call is still blocking.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution.
One some clients this metric will be logged only one time out of one thousand to reduce the overhead of taking the metric.

histogram.name: GPU.EnsureWorkVisibleDurationLowRes
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of EnsureWorkVisible GPU call. Since it's blocking UI thread we want to measure it, and this histogram must be active as long as this call is still blocking.
This is a sister histogram to GPU.EnsureWorkVisibleDuration. The former is our target goal. However it's custom buckets do not have enough granularity to measure improvement steps. This metric will instead cap at 5s, and allow the buckets to give us better visibility into the 15ms-250ms interval ranges. We will use this one until we improve the blocking call.
One some clients this metric will be logged only one time out of one thousand to reduce the overhead of taking the metric.

histogram.name: GPU.EstablishGpuChannelSyncRetry
histogram.summary: Records the result of retrying EstableGpuChannelSync in Chrome OS. Logged every time when a EstableGpuChannel fails on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: GPU.EstablishGpuChannelSyncTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to synchronously establish the GPU channel. Logged every time a sync call to EstableGpuChannelSync is made and a channel is not already available.

histogram.name: GPU.EstablishGpuChannelSyncTime.FirstRun
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to synchronously establish the GPU channel. Logged on the first run of a sync call to EstableGpuChannelSync is made.

histogram.name: GPU.FallbackEventCause
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every GPU launch mode fallback event. Records the cause of the fallback event.

histogram.name: Gpu.FenceHandle.CloneCountsPerSubmit
histogram.summary: Counts the number of GpuFenceHandle clone calls between (post) submits.

histogram.name: GPU.FenceSyncRelease.GraphValidation.ForceReleaseNamespace
histogram.summary: Records the command buffer namespace when TaskGraph validation forcefully releases fence sync.

histogram.name: GPU.FenceSyncRelease.{TaskGraphValidationType}.Cause
histogram.summary: Records the cause of calls to SyncPointManager::EnsureFenceSyncReleased() for releasing fence sync. This histogram is ~1/100 sub-sampled.

histogram.name: GPU.GLImplementation
histogram.summary: Records the OpenGL implementation mode. Recorded during GPU process initilization.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V4
histogram.summary:
The time between the GPU process start and the collection of GPU info during the process's startup phase. The time range is between 5ms and 90s. Emitted after the collection of GPU info. Reported for all clients.
This metric is similar to GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V3, but there are two main differences. First, the range for GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V4 is capped at 90s while the range of the other metric is capped at 5s. Second, this metric is emitted earlier in the execution because this metric is recorded at the same time as trace events which require the timestamp marking the start and end of the GPU initialization to be in scope, whereas V3 only requires the time spent.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessExitCode
histogram.summary: Counts for the exit codes returned by the GPU process when it terminated.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessLaunchTime
histogram.summary: Startup time of the GPU process as measured by the GPU process host.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessTerminationOrigin
histogram.summary: The reason a GPU process is terminated. It works only when TERMINATION_STATUS_PROCESS_WAS_KILLED TerminationStatus is set. The goal of this histogram is to get spikes of the above mentioned case when Ozone/Wayland terminates the GPU process due to invalid data it received if any. NOTE: this metric was expired from 2019-08-14 to 2022-11-30 and was brought back by crrev.com/c/4040947.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessTerminationStatus2
histogram.summary: Counts for each time the GPU Process Host detects the process dies.

histogram.name: Gpu.Graphite.GraphiteImageProviderAccessHitInCache
histogram.summary: For each request of an image from GraphiteImageProvider, records whether the image was found in the cache or needed to be created.

histogram.name: GPU.GraphValidation.Duration
histogram.summary: For each graph validation of TaskGraph, records the time it takes in milliseconds.

histogram.name: GPU.GraphValidation.NeedsForceRelease
histogram.summary: For each graph valiation of TaskGraph, records whether it finds invalid waits that require forceful release.

histogram.name: Gpu.GrCompileShaderUs
histogram.summary:
Time to compile and resolve a Skia OpenGL shader in microseconds.
Only reported on systems which have high resolution timers.

histogram.name: Gpu.GrLinkProgramUs
histogram.summary:
Time to link and resolve a Skia OpenGL program in microseconds.
Only reported on systems which have high resolution timers.

histogram.name: Gpu.GrShaderCacheEnabled
histogram.summary: If the GrShaderCache is in use. Recorded at GPU channel manager creation.

histogram.name: GPU.HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled
histogram.summary:
Records if GPU hardware acceleration is explicitly disabled by the user. Recorded when the browser process launches.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-01-30 to 2022-04-29; data may be missing.

histogram.name: GPU.HardwareSupportsVulkan
histogram.summary:
Records if a device can support running on Vulkan. This value is decided after the first successful GPU service launch and remains constant. If the device doesn't attempt to use Vulkan (eg. it's blocklisted or disabled) or Vulkan compatibility checks fail this will be false.
This is recorded with every ongoing UMA log record, except if the UMA record is finalized before the first successful GPU service launch. This should be uncommon. This metric is NOT recorded in records that reflect information from a previous session (i.e., "stability records" or "persistent UMA" data related to the previous session but not uploaded during the previous session).

histogram.name: GPU.HasDiscreteGpu
histogram.summary:
Records whether the system has a discrete GPU, collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping. This is Windows platform only.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-04-24 to 2022-04-29; data may be missing.

histogram.name: GPU.IntelGpuGeneration
histogram.summary: Records the highest Intel GPU generation of the system using the GPU info collected at GPU process startup time, once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: GPU.IntelGpuSeriesType
histogram.summary: Records user device's GPU series type. Only recorded on Windows platform at GPU process launch time. Only meaningful with Intel GPUs.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.CreationTimeUs
histogram.summary: The time that it took to create an IOSurface. Recorded for every IOSurface that's created. This metric is only collected on Mac, which only has high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Gpu.Mac.BackpressureUs
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU's main CPU thread spends waiting for previous frames' GPU work to complete. Recorded at every frame. This metric is only collected on Mac, which only has high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.MaximumGLESVersion
histogram.summary: Records the maximum GLES version supported on Android. Recorded once per GPU process launch and recorded only for non-ANGLE due to complexities in obtaining this information for ANGLE.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.FamilyMac
histogram.summary: MTLGPUFamilyMac1 is deprecated since macOS 13 and iOS 16. This histograms is meant to gather information so that the WebGPU W3C group can decide whether to drop MTLGPUFamilyMac1 support. The histogram is recorded at GPU process startup time.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.ReadWriteTextureSupport
histogram.summary: Read-write textures are not always supported on Metal. This histograms is meant to gather information so that the WebGPU W3C group can decide whether to require support for this feature. The reported tier is the best tier that was found on the system. Meaning that if only one of the GPUs support read-write textures, a non-zero tier will be reported. The histogram is recorded at GPU process startup time.

histogram.name: GPU.MultiGpu.AMD
histogram.summary: AMD device IDs from multi-gpu devices. Recorded when GPU process launches and sends GPUInfo to browser process.

histogram.name: GPU.MultiGpu.Nvidia
histogram.summary: Nvidia device IDs from multi-gpu devices. Recorded when GPU process launches and sends GPUInfo to browser process.

histogram.name: GPU.OsCompositor.NumLayersModified
histogram.summary: A count of the number of OS compositor layers that were dirtied in a single commit. This estimates the amount of work the OS compositor needs to do per frame and can be used to compare incremental tree updating algorithms.

histogram.name: GPU.Output.HDR
histogram.summary: Records if any connected monitor is HDR capable. Recorded when the gpu process starts. Only recorded on Windows as of M-61. If monitor enumeration fails, this metric will not be provided.

histogram.name: GPU.OutputSurface.InsertRenderPassRecording
histogram.summary: Records if graphite::Recording to draw a render pass was succesfully inserted into the graphite::Context. Recorded for each insertRecording() call made with a render pass recording.

histogram.name: Gpu.OutputSurface.ScheduleOverlaysUs
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU's main CPU thread spends producing pending CALayer tree on Mac. Recorded when Skia output surface schedules overlays at every frame. This metric is only collected on Mac, which only has high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.PaintOpReader.DeserializationError
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the deserialization of a PaintOp failed. Recorded in PaintOpReader::Read* methods when the decoding a paint op fails. These failures are typically caused by an invalid or unexpected state or invalid serialized data.

histogram.name: GPU.PersistentCache.StaleCacheDeleted
histogram.summary: Records if any existing persistent cache databases were deleted due to incompatible versions. Recorded on GPU process launch.

histogram.name: GPU.PersistentCache.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.Load
histogram.summary: Time it takes in gpu::GpuPersistentCache::LoadData (only when it is ready). Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.PersistentCache.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.LoadResult
histogram.summary: Records the results of gpu::GpuPersistentCache::Load for determining cache hit rates.

histogram.name: GPU.PersistentCache.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.Store
histogram.summary: Time it takes in gpu::GpuPersistentCache::StoreData (only when it is ready). Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.PersistentCache.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{LoadStore}.CacheAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the gpu::GpuPersistentCache is ready when {LoadStore}Data() is called. Recorded only for first 100 {LoadStore}.

histogram.name: GPU.Presentation.FrameHandlesAnimationOrInteraction
histogram.summary: Recorded when a display frame is swapped in Viz. It records whether the current frame is handling interaction, animation, both, or none.

histogram.name: GPU.Presentation.VSyncCallbackDelay
histogram.summary:
The VSync callback delay from the system CVDisplayLink or CADisplaylink source to CrGpuMain. Recorded once per frame when OnVSyncPresentation is called. This histogram is ~1/1000 sub-sampled under the CPU reduction experiment. The recorded delay is capped to the maximum of 33 ms.
This metric is only for Mac clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessLifetime2
histogram.summary: GPU process lifetime as measured by GPU process host.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessLifetimeEvents.HardwareAccelerated
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every GPU process launch and crash when GPU process is started for hardware accelerated GPU compositing and/or WebGL. Crash buckets are based on crash count for disabling features. With OOP-D enabled the display compositor also runs in the GPU process.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessLifetimeEvents.SwiftShader
histogram.summary:
Recorded once for every GPU process launch and crash when GPU process is started for SwiftShader WebGL. Crash buckets are based on crash count for disabling features. With OOP-D enabled the display compositor with software compositing will also run as part of the GPU process.
Note this was expired from 2024-12-08 to 2015-03-13.

histogram.name: GPU.RasterDecoder.TimeToFlush
histogram.summary: Time it takes for RasterDecoderImpl::FlushSurfaces() to complete. Recorded for the first 100 flushes.

histogram.name: GPU.RequestAdapterStatus.WebGPU
histogram.summary: The result of requesting a WebGPU adapater. Recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: GPU.Sandboxed
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates whether sandboxing is successfully applied. A value of true means the GPU is sandboxed. A value of false means the GPU is not sandboxed. Recorded once per GPU process start-up in gpu_init.cc.

histogram.name: GPU.ShaderLoadPrefixOK
histogram.summary: Whether or not the shader prefix loaded from disk matched the expected prefix for the data and system configuration. False indicates either disk corruption or a system configuration change, and should be rare.

histogram.name: GPU.SharedImage.BackingType
histogram.summary: Records the type of each SharedImageBacking that's initialized/registered.

histogram.name: GPU.SharedImage.SharedImageFormat
histogram.summary: Records the SharedImageFormat type for a SharedImageBacking that's initialized/registered.

histogram.name: GPU.SkiaBackendType
histogram.summary: Records what backend Skia is initialized with for compositing/rasterization in the GPU process. This is only recorded the first time Skia is initialized per GPU process launch, in case it's initialized on more than one thread or reinitialized on context loss.

histogram.name: GPU.SoftwareRendering
histogram.summary: Collects whether Chrome uses software renderer or hardware GPU 20 seconds after Chrome starts, and records this value once per UMA ping. This value is not re-collected at each recording time because GPU process could crash for various reasons and fall back to software rendering. This value is intended to reflect device capabilities rather than the current state.

histogram.name: GPU.TransferCache.EntryFound
histogram.summary: Whether a transfer cache entry is found when trying to retrieve it. Recorded on every transfer cache look up.

histogram.name: GPU.TransferCache.MaxHistoricalTimeSinceLastUse
histogram.summary: When a transfer cache is found, record max historical time between reuses. Recorded on every successful transfer cache look up.

histogram.name: GPU.TransferCache.ReusedTimes
histogram.summary: When a transfer cache entry is deleted, record how many times it was used. Recorded when an entry is deleted.

histogram.name: GPU.TransferCache.TimeSinceLastUse
histogram.summary: When a transfer cache is found, record the time since last use. Recorded on every successful transfer cache look up.

histogram.name: GPU.TransferCache.TimeSinceLastUseOnDelete
histogram.summary: When a transfer cache entry is deleted, record the last time the entry was used. Recorded when an entry is deleted.

histogram.name: GPU.Vulkan.PipelineCache.vkCreateGraphicsPipelines
histogram.summary: Duration of vkCreateGraphicsPipelines call. Recorded every time Skia creates graphics pipeline. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.Event{ThreadType}
histogram.summary: Recorded for each time the GPU watchdog thread starts, crashes and ends.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.Timeout{WatchdogStage}{ThreadType}
histogram.summary: Recorded timeout events when the GPU watchdog enters OnWatchdogTimeout.

histogram.name: GPU.WebGLDisplayType
histogram.summary: Types of EGL displays used to back WebGL contexts. Recorded at context creation time in the GPU process.

histogram.name: GPU.{ANGLEOrGraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.D3D11.Create{ShaderType}ShaderUs
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time in microseconds it takes to create a D3D11 {ShaderType} shader. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

variant.name: GraphiteDawn
variant.summary: Graphite Dawn

histogram.name: Gpu.{CacheType}LoadHitInCache
histogram.summary: For each load of an entry from {CacheType}, records whether the entry was found in the cache. Expired on June 1 2024 and revived on June 11 2024.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.Create{Module}Success
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a call to Create{Module} was successful, excluding when the result is found in frontend cache.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.Create{Module}US
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time in microseconds it takes for a call to Create{Module} to complete, excluding when the result is found in frontend cache. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.D3DDeviceRemovedReason
histogram.summary: Error codes received when checking for D3D device removal reason. HRESULT is DXGI error code that listed at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11/nf-d3d11-id3d11device-getdeviceremovedreason

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.HasGpuAdapter
histogram.summary: Records whether WebGPU or Graphite Dawn has any GPU adapters available. This is recorded during GPU process startup.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.MaxStorageBufferBindingSize.{AdapterType}
histogram.summary: Records the maximum storage buffer binding size if {AdapterType} GPU is available. This is recorded during GPU process startup.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.MaxTextureDimension2D.{AdapterType}
histogram.summary: Records the maximum 2D texture dimensions if {AdapterType} GPU is available. This is recorded during GPU process startup.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.Support
histogram.summary: WebGPU or Graphite Dawn support level. Recorded on GPU info collection a couple minutes after browser startup. Compatibility mode support means that WebGPU or Graphite Dawn is supported on a non-core backend like OpenGLES. Core backends can always support compatibility mode so compat-on-core-adapter is not reported in this metric. Supported means at least one adapter of that type was available. Blocklisted means all adapters of that type were blocklisted. None means that no adapters of that type were available. Software adapters are considered as None in this metric.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.CacheHit
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time in microseconds it takes for a cached call to {Cacheable} to complete without error when we have a cache hit. This includes the load time from the cache and time to deserialize the result. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.CacheHit.Counts.1stPresent
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of cache hits for {Cacheable} for the 1st Presentation. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.CacheHit.Percentage.1stPresent
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage of cache hits for {Cacheable} for the 1st Presentation. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.CacheHit.Percentage.90SecondsPostStartup
histogram.summary: Tracks the percentage of cache hits for {Cacheable} within 90 seconds of browser start up. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.CacheMiss
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time in microseconds it takes for a cached call to {Cacheable} to complete without error when we have a cache miss. This includes the time necessary to create the results of {Cacheable} from scratch, but does not include the time taken to write the results back into the cache. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.{CacheHitMiss}.90SecondsPostStartup
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time in microseconds it takes for a cached call to {Cacheable}.{CacheHitMiss} to complete without error when we have a cache hit or miss within 90 seconds of browser start up. Based off the {Cacheable}.CacheHit and {Cacheable}.CacheMiss metrics above. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{Cacheable}.{CacheHitMiss}.Counts.90SecondsPostStartup
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times calls to {Cacheable}.{CacheHitMiss} are emitted within 90 seconds of browser start up. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{GraphiteDawnOrWebGPU}.{ShaderTiming}
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time in microseconds it takes for a call to {ShaderTiming} to complete, excluding when the result is found in frontend cache. Recorded only for clients that support high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.{SchedulerType}.{Stage}
histogram.summary: Records the wall time for GPU {SchedulerType} task at various stages. {Stage}. Only recorded for clients with high resolution clocks. Note that the histograms for GPU.Scheduler.* was expired on 2022-08-07 and is re-enabled on 2023-11-17.

variant.name: TaskDependencyTime
variant.summary: Records the wall time taken spent by each GPU scheduler task waiting on it's dependencies to resolve. The time delta starts when the waiting fence is added and finishes when the last fence is removed

variant.name: TaskSchedulingDelayTime
variant.summary: Records the wall time taken spent by each GPU scheduler task waiting on to be scheduled once all its dependencies have been resolved. The time delta starts when the last waiting fence is passed and stops when the tasks starts running. If the schedulers is working properly, for a high priority task, this metric should be minimal

variant.name: ThreadSuspendedTime
variant.summary: Records the wall time taken between calls to schedule the task run and the actual run of the task. Ideally this should always be as close to 0 as possible

histogram.name: Graphics.Exo.Surface.{ExoSurfaceCodePaths}
histogram.summary: Track usage of different code paths in Exo surface code. We should monitor and remove all deprecated code path if they have never been executed.

histogram.name: Skia.Graphite.PipelineCache.PipelineUsesInEpoch
histogram.summary:
This reports the number of Pipelines used in a five-minute window. This provides information regarding the size of the optimal Pipeline active set.
This is only recorded on clients using both Graphite and Precompilation. It is recorded every five minutes.

histogram.name: Skia.Graphite.PipelineCreationRace
histogram.summary: Records the number of Pipeline creation races in Skia broken down by the origin (Normal compilation vs Pre-compilation) and which instances won (i.e., made it into the cache before the other one).

histogram.name: Skia.Graphite.PipelineCreationTimes.{CompilationType}
histogram.summary:
Measures the time taken to create a Pipeline in Skia's Dawn backend for {CompilationType} compilations.
This is only recorded on clients with high-resolution clocks.

variant.name: Asynchronous
variant.summary: Asynchronous Normal compilations

variant.name: Precompile
variant.summary: Synchronous Pre-compilations

variant.name: Synchronous
variant.summary: Synchronous Normal compilations

histogram.name: Skia.Graphite.Precompile.{PipelineStatistic}
histogram.summary:
Reports the number of Pipelines that were categorized as {PipelineStatistic}.
This is only recorded on clients using both Graphite and Precompilation. It is recorded after a 30 minute delay.

variant.name: NormalPreemptedByPrecompile
variant.summary: Reports the number of times a Precompiled Pipeline is chosen over a Normally compiled Pipeline. This is roughly the benefit Chromium is seeing from Precompilation. Higher is better.

variant.name: UnpreemptedPrecompilePipelines
variant.summary: Reports the number of times a Precompiled Pipeline reaches the Pipeline cache. A Precompiled Pipeline may be pruned before reaching the cache either because it was preempted by a Normal Pipeline or by a different Precompilation Pipeline. This is roughly the overall cost Chromium is incurring for Precompilation. Lower is better as long as NormalPreemptedByPrecompile doesn't decrease.

variant.name: UnusedPrecompiledPipelines
variant.summary: Reports the number of times a Precompiled Pipeline is either purged from the Pipeline cache before being ever used or is residing (unused) in the Pipeline cache after 30 minutes. This is roughly the wasted cost of over-generation in the Precompilation system. Ideally this would be zero.

histogram.name: Skia.VulkanMemoryAllocator.AmountAllocated
histogram.summary:
The total amount of memory that the VulkanMemoryAllocator used by Skia's Vulkan backend has allocated. This is GPU memory for VkImages and VkBuffers. Note that the allocator may be shared with other users outside of Skia and this amount includes their uses as well. This is collected each time we request an allocation from Skia.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-09-01 to 2025-04-02; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Viz.BeginFrameSource.Accuracy.AverageDelta2
histogram.summary:
The average time delta between the expected BeginFrame time and the actual time of BeginFrame on Mac. Each recorded number is an average result of 3600 frames. It's recorded every 3600 frames when OnBeginFrame or OnTimerTick is called. The max delta is capped to 33 ms.
This metric is only for Mac clients with high-resolution clocks.
Expired on 2025-08-24 and restarted on 2025-09-09.

histogram.name: Viz.BeginFrameSource.VrrFrameCount
histogram.summary: This is logged once per session of the variable refresh rate (VRR) feature being enabled. This counts the number of BeginFrames which are issued using VRR.

histogram.name: Viz.BeginFrameSource.VSyncCallbackDelay
histogram.summary:
The VSync callback delay from the system CVDisplayLink or CADisplaylink source to VizCompositorThread. Recorded once per frame when OnDisplayLinkCallback is called. This histogram is ~1/1000 sub-sampled under the CPU reduction experiment. The recorded delay is capped to the maximum of 33 ms.
This metric is only for Mac clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Viz.CompositorFrameSinkSupport.HasSurfaceAnimationManagerOnAnimate
histogram.summary: Records if SurfaceAnimationManager is cached by FrameSinkManagerImpl on Animate. The SurfaceAnimationManager may not be cached if CompositorFrameTransitionDirective::Type::kAnimateRenderer directive is issued before CompositorFrameTransitionDirective::Type::kSave directive is completely processed leading to an incomplete CopyOutputRequest.

histogram.name: Viz.CreateFallbackImageResult
histogram.summary: This is recorded each time SkiaRenderer attempts to create a fallback image to replace a missing shared image. The result captures success and failure with a reason for the failure.

histogram.name: Viz.DelegatedCompositing.Status
histogram.summary: An enum status result for attempted delegated compositing (success or failure reason) recorded every drawn frame.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayNumProposedCandidates
histogram.summary: A count of the number of proposed overlay candidates available for overlay selection. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayStrategy
histogram.summary: Overlay strategies used to promote Hardware Overlays, once or more per frame. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor, or once per overlay promoted if multiple were promoted.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.RootDamageRect.Overlay
histogram.summary: Any root damage excluding overlay damage in the current frame?

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.RootDamageRect.Underlay
histogram.summary: The root damage type excluding underlay damage in the current frame.

histogram.name: Viz.ExternalBeginFrameSource.Interval
histogram.summary: Frame interval, as provided in OnBeginFrame() for external sources. Subsampled, but recorded at BeginFrame() time.

histogram.name: Viz.ExternalBeginFrameSourceMac.DisplayLink
histogram.summary: The result of creating CVDisplaylink in ExternalBeginFrameSourceMac. If successful, BeginFrameSource is driven by HW VSync instead of timer. This histogram does not include the data from DelayBasedBeginFrameSourceMac. It's recorded each time a DisplayLink is created during RootCompositorFrameSinkImpl/ExternalBeginFrameSourceMac creation or during the monitor change in the existing ExternalBeginFrameSourceMac.

histogram.name: Viz.FileDescriptorTracking.TimeToCompute
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing the number of active File Descriptors. This is logged once every 5 minutes as the cost of this computation is estimated to be at least 1ms.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Viz.FileDescriptorTracking.{FdStat}
histogram.summary: {FdStat} File Descriptors for the GPU process. This is logged once every 5 minutes as the cost of this computation is estimated to be at least 1ms.

variant.name: NumActive
variant.summary: Current number of active

variant.name: NumSoftMax
variant.summary: Maximum number of

variant.name: PercentageUsed
variant.summary: Percentage of in use

histogram.name: Viz.FrameIntervalDecider.ActualIntervalDefault
histogram.summary: Record the actual frame rate when FrameIntervalDecider decides system should use its default behavior. Useful as reference histogram for ActualIntervalForXXhz histograms, to see the effect of FrameIntervalDecider deciding on a particular frame rate. Note however it's not a perfect reference since the conditions leading to use system default is not independent from conditions leading a particular frame rate being selected. Recorded every viz frame, sub-sampled with probability 0.001. Note this requires FrameIntervalDecider to be enabled as well as using an ExternalBeginFrameSource.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameIntervalDecider.ActualIntervalFor{DecidedHz}hz
histogram.summary: For a few common result intervals (named in hz), record the distribution of actual frame intervals. Recorded every viz frame, sub-sampled with probability 0.001. Note this requires FrameIntervalDecider to be enabled as well as using an ExternalBeginFrameSource.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameIntervalDecider.ResultMatcherType
histogram.summary: Frame interval matcher type matched current frame. Recorded every viz frame, sub-sampled with probability 0.001.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameIntervalDecider.ResultTimeDelta
histogram.summary: Frame interval decider result interval. Recorded every viz frame but only if the result variant is an interval time delta, sub-sampled with probability 0.001.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSink.GpuBusyDuration
histogram.summary:
The time that a begin frame is throttled due to max pending swaps. Recorded when draw and swap executes (only when a frame is throttled). Refer to BeginFrameSource::SetIsGpuBusy for details.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for frame capture until the result becomes available to the capturer.
Format-agnostic version of `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[NV12/I420].CaptureDuration` histograms.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary:
Whether a capture initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.
Format-agnostic version of `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[NV12/I420].CaptureSucceeded` histograms.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.FrameResurrected
histogram.summary: True if the capturer has used a resurrected video frame, thus avoiding having to reserve it from a frame pool, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an I420 readback until the result comes back and ReadI420Planes successfully finishes.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-03-07 to 2022-03-10; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary:
Whether an I420 readback initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-12-31 to 2022-03-10; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl decided that a new I420 frame needs to be produced to the moment when it was ready to deliver it. This encompasses the `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureDuration` time, but also includes time taken to render video capture overlays.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an NV12 copy until the result comes back.
Note: The histogram logging was adjusted in M102 to align with how `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[RGBA/I420].CaptureDuration` histograms behave. After the change, this histogram also started including the time taken to set the color space on a video frame.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether an NV12 capture initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl decided that a new NV12 frame needs to be produced to the moment when it was ready to deliver it. This encompasses the `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.CaptureDuration` time.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.ReserveFrameDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took for a frame pool to reserve a video frame that would then have its contents populated by the capturer. Will be logged only when `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.FrameResurrected` is false.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.RGBA.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an RGBA readback until the result comes back and ReadRGBAPlane successfully finishes.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.TotalDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl decided that a new frame needs to be produced to the moment when it was ready to deliver it. This encompasses the `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.CaptureDuration` time, but also includes time taken to render video capture overlays.
Format-agnostic version of `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[NV12/I420].TotalDuration` histograms.
